intro: Talisia elephantipes, commonly known as the giant talisia, is a woody shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Talisia elephantipes is often found in humid, lowland forests and is adapted to thrive in shaded environments. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally in local medicine for their potential healing properties.
